page.title: 01The Area_Its Location
page.content: The area which includes the villages of Pontyberem and Bancffosfelen, is situated in the valley of the River Gwendraeth Fawr. It lies within the parish of Pontyberem, which was created in 1919. Previous to this, the area was included, on the southern side of the river,in the parish of Llannon and on the northern side,in the parish of Llangyndeyrn. Prior to the industrialisation of the valley in the mid_nineteenth century,both villages were agricultural in character with many scattered homesteads.The area quickly developed as its anthracite coal measures were exploited.Owing to its position on the ridge of the valley slope,Bancffosfelen has kept much of its rural character.The area is between Llanelli and Carmarthen.B4306.
